content: Sheesh, turns out it was a case of "mistaken identity", incorrect password notations somewhere in our notes. Got it sorted as that. Not helpful, however, that the 1014 error did not include a more verbose explanation; somewhere between the xfinity imap/smtp servers, and TB treatment of the same messages.
creator: mwpowelllde

content:
In these situations, Thunderbird simply passes on the error message it is given by the server. It has no way of knowing what that error actually means, so it just passes it along verbatim. Despite common assumptions (often encouraged by support folk I admit), those numbers are largely relevant only to the software package installed on the server issuing the error.

You might also look at this topic which reported the same error. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1348887

The very last post is enlightening really if it is still so.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Update: This afternoon, before attempting to start T'bird, I installed the new release *and* restored the "Profile" folder from a backup that had been taken last Friday, three full days before the problem reported above. Then I started T'bird. Problems continue: 

  (1) Even though there have more than 100 new messages since last Friday, it sees "No new messages", BUT (2) when allowed just to run, the amount of memory being consumed grew steadily from maybe 1 1/2 G to more than 11 G, was still ticking steadily upward when I clicked the Task Manager's "End Process" button.

Since reloading the profile from a backup made before T'bird went off the rails did NOT get it back on track, some aspect(s) of its internal state must be saved or retained elsewhere than in the profile folder. Please, what else needs to be restored to revive normal operation, and where is it hidden???

Thanks...
creator: IrvT

content: I suggest you try using your operating systems "safe" mode. It is probably a program that loads when windows starts. If it is not an issue in safe mode, look at the programs that load with the operating system, Include your antivirus in the suspect pool. They are notorious for causing issues.

content:
Proviamo una cosa: Fai un backup del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo Poi va nella stessa cartella del profilo, apri la cartella IMAPMAIL, poi nella cartella relativa all'account Qui se trovi i file Unsent Messages (senza estensione) e Unsent Messages.mfs eliminali

Poi fai la stessa cosa ripartendo dalla cartella del profilo, aprendo poi la cartella Mail, quindi la cartella Local Folder. Anche qui se ci sono elimina i file Unsent Messages (senza estensione) e Unsent Messages.mfs

Fai tutto a Thunderbird chiuso. Tieni conto che se hai dei messaggi non ancora spediti questi andranno persi.

creator: markh2

content: Dank Mark, dat schept wel iets verheldering. Ben nog aan het testen geweest, en blijkbaar is het gedrag anders als je SHIFT+Delete gebruikt i.p.v. Delete. Direct permanent verwijderen met SHIFT+Delete zorgt ervoor dat de e-mail wel uit de INbox wordt gehaald, maar vervolgens wel in "Alle e-mail" blijft staan. De optie permanent verwijderen heb je niet bij web-Gmail, dus eigenlijk moet deze ook niet in Thunderbird beschikbaar zijn. Of is er een manier om Thunderbird zo te configureren dat SHIFT+Delete het e-mail-item zowel uit de Inbox als uit "Alle e-mail" haalt?
creator: reinier.beenen

content: Kennelijk werkt het helaas zo; Gmail maakt gebruik van een wat afwijkend protocol, waardoor dit soort zaken kunnen ontstaan. Als ik dit artikel zo lees, komt het gebruik van Shift+Del bij Gmail neer op archiveren, wat het blijven bestaan in de map ‘Alle berichten’ verklaart (daar worden gearchiveerde berichten namelijk standaard geplaatst). In dit artikel wordt dit in wat ingewikkelder termen nog eens beschreven. Ik ben bang dat er geen echte oplossing voor is.
creator: markh2

Puoi reimpostare la password principale seguendo questa procedura -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/password-principale-thunderbird#w_reimpostare-una-password-principale-dimenticata-o-persa

Però verranno cancellati tutti i login (nome utente e password) memorizzati e dovrai reinserirli alla prima connessione). Dopo averla reimpostata, puoi anche eliminare la password come spiegato nella stessa guida.

content: The cache is not emails, it is just temporary work areas, such as downloaded graphics in emails so they can be viewed within a message. Messages are retained within the message folders. I clear cache daily, sometimes more often, on both Thunderbird and Windows.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hello there We have read the question We try to help

Your cache is safe to delete it concerns your Thunderbird software. This cache contains several files that are in contact with other types of larger files. Small assignments that also have goeing inspections with other smaller assignments for data or a version on your PC computer machine, for example. In this case for your email program. You can safely erase the Thundetbird cache, if necessary, it will be supplemented again, so that it was filled with it.

Emails are going to vanish after refreshing the cache of thunderbird ? Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Thanks, David, but this is part of what confuses me: "such as downloaded graphics in emails so they can be viewed within a message."

Does that mean that if I clear the cache, and then I'm working offline, those graphics will not be available to view in the messages?

How can I make sure that messages are fully downloaded and available on my hard drive, even when I'm offline?
creator: Catemaco

content: When you view a graphic, it is a file in itself and Thunderbird copies it into memory so it can display it. The cache is only a temporary work space. If not sure, then do a full backup of your profile and then clear the cache and verify that nothing is lost. I have my thunderbird set to clear cache when a small size is reached, causing it to clear daily.
creator: davidsk

content:
More information: After reading this thread: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1387237 I verified that my problem is that the "User Name" field in the SMTP dialog has to be the same as the e-mail address. (This is probably a Yahoo mail thing.) The problem (as mentioned in the above thread), is if I change the user name in one account, it changes in the other SMTP dialog as well. So I have to go into the SMTP dialog every time I want to change to sending using the other account.

In this thread: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1447737 The user talks about creating "a different SMTP server name for each account." Unfortunately, I have no idea how to do that and the user doesn't say.

Any assistance would be welcome.
